name: Scallops with Oranges and Vanilla Beurre Blanc
author: Juliana Hale
summary: Tender pan-fried scallops are topped with a vanilla beurre blanc made from shallots, reduced white wine, and orange juice.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped inner celery leaves, or to taste
directions: Bring wine, orange juice, and shallot to a boil in a small saucepan
Reduce heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, until about 2 tablespoons of liquid remains, about 10 minutes
Add cream; simmer until mixture is almost evaporated, 1 to 2 minutes more
Whisk in 8 tablespoons cold butter, 1 tablespoon at a time, until incorporated
Strain and discard shallot, then whisk in vanilla
Rinse scallops and pat dry with paper towels
Heat oil and remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add scallops; cook, turning once, until browned and opaque, 3 to 5 minutes total
Top scallops with the orange sauce, orange sections, and celery leaves
